Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> HUSH was on it's own codebase back when we made BTCH, it was a way to experiment with KMD tech for me, and learn

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it was the first 4-way airdrop onto a new blockchain, that I know of

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and because Hush didn't have Bitcore merged back then, doing a snapshot of addresses/balances was massive work

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Back then, KMD asset chains could not be mineable, so BTCH is not mineable, currently

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> There are plans to convert BTCH to a 50/50 PoS/PoW chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> BTCH is another chain to run HushList protocol things, and also has slightly different features than HUSH currently, although both are asset chains

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @RunningMantheCoin it sounds like you could answer a lot of questions of @gigamesh that I described to you recently, about early days

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh Original Zcash genesis block was October 17th 2016: http://zcashnetwork.info/block/00040fe8ec8471911baa1db1266ea15dd06b4a8a5c453883c000b031973dce08

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Original Hush genesis block was less than a month later, Nov 17th 2016: https://explorer.hush.zelcore.io/block/0003a67bc26fe564b75daf11186d360652eb435a35ba3d9d3e7e5d5f8e62dc17

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Zcash was Oct 28th actually. Hush launched less than a month after Zcash (and originally was called Zdash for like 5 minutes)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Komodo launched September 13th 2016: https://komodod.com/b/0a47c1323f393650f7221c217d19d149d002d35444f47fde61be2dd90fbde8e6

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Yes, Komodo actually launched before Zcash. They took the code and made a genesis block before Zcash

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So KMD + HUSH were the first 2 Zcash source code forks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> And KMD actually forked before Zcash even made a genblock

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Original Lead dev of Zdash/Hush was Joseph Stuhlman, who gave lead dev over to radix42: https://twitter.com/jstuhlman

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> That was before my involvement

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> `so did Zdash actually use the memo field?` <-- Zdash = Hush, so yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It was only called Zdash for like 5 minutes. The original Bitcoin Talk ANN about Zdash was edited and changed to Hush, nobody seems to have the original Zdash ANN

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh you asked lots of good questions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> `so the original concept came from the "early devs", not from v1 paper? how much did the v1 paper change the ideas in Zdash/Hush?` - No, I would not agree to that first statement. The v1 HushList whitepaper was written by me, from kernels of ideas from radix42. The HushList v1 whitepaper defined the purpose/reason for Hush to exist

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> additionally: radix42 is the Savior Of The Memo Field. What does this mean?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> radix42 was there when Zcash Protocol was being made and made sure the memo field existed, it was going to be removed

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So radix42 was instrumental in the Zcash Protocol design, especially the memo field, and Hush finally became the Zcash fork that specialized in the memo field

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Originally, Zdash didn't have a focus or a purpose. It was just one of the first 2 ZEC forks ever, things were different back then.

Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> so Stuhlman sets up a fork with no purpose, radix then joined with the memo field messaging/mailing concept, you guys then wrote the paper (not published till ~14months after coin launch), shortly after which radix left and you took over. is that it roughly?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> is it still correct to call Hush a ZEC fork now KMD is upstream?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> NVM ill use the wording from para1 v3 paper

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush is still a Zcash fork, because KMD is still a Zcash fork

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush is now a fork of a fork of Zcash source code, instead of just "a fork"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> i wouldn't call it "zerocash code", that has very specific meaning

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Zcash is an improvement upon Zerocash Protocol and there was a Zerocash coin

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> not sure about "so Stuhlman sets up a fork with no purpose" but maybe "Stuhlman created the second Zcash fork, after Komodo"
